page.title: 14St.Germans Village Sign
page.content:
The village of St.Germans is named after St.Germanus, an early bishop who worked in France. As a boy and young man, he is reputed to have been a woodcutter, and the village sign (a painted woodcarving which tops a pole at the entrance to the village) shows him felling a tree, in red knickerbockers and a blue plush shirt.
He hunted and enjoyed life...then a vision turned him overnight into a saintly Christian, who became first a minister and then a bishop.
The Saint's story is told more fully on famous pew-end woodcarvings in the village church. These were partially defaced by Cromwell's army, but are still a powerful reminder of the past.
